subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: {{Han simp|徑|f=巠|t=𢀖}} based on the table of 54 simplified radical components listed in the 1956 {{w|Chinese Character Simplification Scheme}} by the People's Republic of China. <!-- Refer https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/漢字簡化方案#漢字偏旁簡化表 -->

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han simp|逕}} which is listed as a variant traditional form of {{l|zh|徑}} in the 1956 first round revision table of variant Chinese characters ({{w2|zh|第一批异体字整理表}}) by the People's Republic of China.<!-- Refer https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/第一批异体字整理表/1955年 -->

As a variant form, {{l|zh|逕}} is to be replaced by {{l|zh|徑}} as its orthodox form, which is succeeded by <font size=4, lang=zh-Hans>径</font> as the simplified form of {{l|zh|徑}}.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Note that in modern Taiwan, {{l|zh|徑}} and {{l|zh|逕}} are considered as two different characters while in mainland China, {{l|zh|逕}} is considered a variant traditional form of {{l|zh|徑}}. <!-- Refer Character 1163, https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/通用規范漢字表 -->

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
Unorthodox variant {{Han simp|徑|f=巠|t=圣|nocap=y}} found in a {{w|Movable type#Metal movable type in China|moveable type}} copy of the classical {{w|Classic Chinese Novels|Chinese novel}} {{w|Jin Ping Mei}} 《{{w2|zh|金瓶梅}}》.

First attested in 《{{w2|zh|宋元以來俗字譜}}》, a {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant forms}} dictionary compiled in 1930 that records unorthodox forms ({{l|zh|俗字}}) that have existed since the {{w|Song dynasty}}.

Another similar character, which has (<big>⿱ス土</big>) as its right component can also be found in <big>《太平樂府》</big>.
